arm_group.description: The pharmacist will download and configure the Dosecast smartphone application to remind the patient to take their medication in addition to pharmacist counseling on the importance of adherence.
This arm will receive only counseling from the pharmacist with no other intervention.

brief_summary.textblock:
This research study is to see if smartphone applications help college women remember to take
      birth control better than pharmacist consultation alone.  Patients will participate in this
      study for 6 (six) months.  The study will have two groups.  Patients will be randomly
      assigned to one group or the other.  The control group will be counseled by the pharmacist
      on the importance of taking birth control as prescribed.  The study group will get the same
      counseling, but will also be set up to receive reminders to take medication on a smartphone
      application called Dosecast.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of a Smartphone Application on Oral Contraceptive Adherence in College Females

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  female gender

          -  18-29 years of age

          -  current prescription for an OCP

          -  currently enrolled as a student at the institution associated with the   pharmacy

          -  possession of a compatible smartphone.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnant patients

          -  Patients who become pregnant during the study will discontinue, but their data up
             until time of discontinuation will be used

          -  Patients using other forms of contraception (patch, injection, IUD, intra-vaginal
             ring, implant).

intervention.description: The Dosecast app is configured to remind the patient to take their medication.

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of a Smartphone Application on Oral Contraceptive Adherence in College Females: a Randomized-controlled Trial.

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Number of doses of oral contraceptive missed over a six-month period.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
